treatment.file: Cells polymorphous disks and dishes, about 0.3-2.5 µm in diameter and usually 0.2 µm thick. Networks of cannulae formed. Growth by hydrogen-sulfur autotrophy, or in the presence of yeast extract, on H2/CO2 and sulfite. Optimal growth temperature around 105˚C. Growth between 0.2-12% NaCl and pH 4.5-7.2. The mol % G+C of the DNA is 62 (Tm). Chemolithotrophic. H2S is formed from sulfur and hydrogen. Non-motile. Strictly anaerobic.
